:target{id="module-werkzeug.urls"}

# URL Helpers

<Outline domain="py" objectType="function" target={"werkzeug.urls.iri_to_uri"} module={"werkzeug.urls"} fullname={"iri_to_uri"} parameters={["iri"]} description={"Convert an IRI to a URI. All non-ASCII and unsafe characters are\nquoted. If the URL has a domain, it is encoded to Punycode."}>
  <Outline.Signature fullname="iri_to_uri" id="werkzeug.urls.iri_to_uri">
    <Outline.Prefix>werkzeug.urls.</Outline.Prefix><Outline.Name>iri\_to\_uri</Outline.Name><Outline.ParameterList><span>(</span><Outline.Parameter><span className="name">iri</span></Outline.Parameter><span>)</span></Outline.ParameterList>
  </Outline.Signature>

  <Outline.Content>
    Convert an IRI to a URI. All non-ASCII and unsafe characters are
    quoted. If the URL has a domain, it is encoded to Punycode.

    ```python
    >>> iri_to_uri('http://\u2603.net/p\xe5th?q=\xe8ry%DF')
    'http://xn--n3h.net/p%C3%A5th?q=%C3%A8ry%DF'
    ```

    <FieldList>
      <dl>
        <dt className="field-name">
          Parameters
        </dt>

        <dd className="field-body">
          <Outline.ParameterTarget>iri</Outline.ParameterTarget> ([<em>str</em>](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")) – The IRI to convert.
        </dd>

        <dt className="field-name">
          Return type
        </dt>

        <dd className="field-body">
          [str](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")
        </dd>
      </dl>
    </FieldList>

    <Container type="info" title="Version changed">
      <span>Changed in version 3.0: </span>Passing a tuple or bytes, the `charset` and `errors` parameters,
      and the `safe_conversion` parameter, are removed.
    </Container>

    <Container type="info" title="Version changed">
      <span>Changed in version 2.3: </span>Which characters remain unquoted is specific to each part of the URL.
    </Container>

    <Container type="info" title="Version changed">
      <span>Changed in version 0.15: </span>All reserved characters remain unquoted. Previously, only some reserved
      characters were left unquoted.
    </Container>

    <Container type="info" title="Version changed">
      <span>Changed in version 0.9.6: </span>The `safe_conversion` parameter was added.
    </Container>

    <Container type="info" title="Version added">
      <span>New in version 0.6.</span>
    </Container>
  </Outline.Content>
</Outline>

<Outline domain="py" objectType="function" target={"werkzeug.urls.uri_to_iri"} module={"werkzeug.urls"} fullname={"uri_to_iri"} parameters={["uri"]} description={"Convert a URI to an IRI. All valid UTF-8 characters are unquoted,\nleaving all reserved and invalid characters quoted. If the URL has\na domain, it is decoded from Punycode."}>
  <Outline.Signature fullname="uri_to_iri" id="werkzeug.urls.uri_to_iri">
    <Outline.Prefix>werkzeug.urls.</Outline.Prefix><Outline.Name>uri\_to\_iri</Outline.Name><Outline.ParameterList><span>(</span><Outline.Parameter><span className="name">uri</span></Outline.Parameter><span>)</span></Outline.ParameterList>
  </Outline.Signature>

  <Outline.Content>
    Convert a URI to an IRI. All valid UTF-8 characters are unquoted,
    leaving all reserved and invalid characters quoted. If the URL has
    a domain, it is decoded from Punycode.

    ```python
    >>> uri_to_iri("http://xn--n3h.net/p%C3%A5th?q=%C3%A8ry%DF")
    'http://\u2603.net/p\xe5th?q=\xe8ry%DF'
    ```

    <FieldList>
      <dl>
        <dt className="field-name">
          Parameters
        </dt>

        <dd className="field-body">
          <Outline.ParameterTarget>uri</Outline.ParameterTarget> ([<em>str</em>](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")) – The URI to convert.
        </dd>

        <dt className="field-name">
          Return type
        </dt>

        <dd className="field-body">
          [str](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.11)")
        </dd>
      </dl>
    </FieldList>

    <Container type="info" title="Version changed">
      <span>Changed in version 3.0: </span>Passing a tuple or bytes, and the `charset` and `errors` parameters,
      are removed.
    </Container>

    <Container type="info" title="Version changed">
      <span>Changed in version 2.3: </span>Which characters remain quoted is specific to each part of the URL.
    </Container>

    <Container type="info" title="Version changed">
      <span>Changed in version 0.15: </span>All reserved and invalid characters remain quoted. Previously,
      only some reserved characters were preserved, and invalid bytes
      were replaced instead of left quoted.
    </Container>

    <Container type="info" title="Version added">
      <span>New in version 0.6.</span>
    </Container>
  </Outline.Content>
</Outline>
